title: Advertising revenue spend for Sheffield Star and Johnston Press plc

content:
Dear Sheffield City Council,
I wish to know how much Sheffield Council has spent on advertising in the Sheffield Star, or via it's parent company, Johnston Press plc, in the last five years.
This includes buying pages for public announcements, taking out advertorials, or any other related activity that necessitated Sheffield Council giving money to the paper or it's parent company.
Yours faithfully,
William Jones

Re – Freedom of Information Request – Reference – FOI / 1680
Dear William Jones,
Thank you for your recent request for information relating to Advertising
revenue spend for Sheffield Star and Johnston Press plc which we received
on 29/01/18.
This has been logged as a Freedom of Information Request, and will be
dealt with under the Freedom of Information Act.  The reference number for
your request can be found above.
The Freedom of Information Act states that we must respond to you within
20 working days, therefore, you should expect to hear a response from us
by 26/02/18.
In the meantime, if you have any queries please contact us on the number
below.
Thank you.
Yours sincerely,

Re – Freedom of Information Request – Reference – FOI / 1680
Dear William Jones,
Thank you for your recent request for information relating to Advertising
revenue spend for Sheffield Star and Johnston Press plc which we received
on 29/01/18.
Please find below, Sheffield City Council’s response to your request:
Further to you request the Council can confirm that payment information is
available online via our open data platform available from
[1]
http://data.sheffield.gov.uk
(using the keyword Spend). This will allow
you to review payments made to Johnston Press/the Sheffield Star during
the period requested. As this information is accessible by other means it
is exempt from disclosure under Section 21(1) of the Freedom of
Information Act 2000. In the same regard records pending publication was
also exempt from disclosure under Section 22 of the Act; as this is part
of our transparency code publication requirements we feel the public
interest does reside in the application of this exemption.  Our finance
management system will not individually record the different forms of
“advertising” you have quoted in your request but the publically
accessible information will provide a benchmark of the Council spend with
these organisations.
If you have any queries about this response, please do not hesitate to
contact us.
If you are unhappy with the response you have received in relation to your
request, you are entitled to have this reviewed.  You can ask for an
internal review by either writing to the above address or by emailing
[2][Sheffield City Council request email].
If you remain dissatisfied with the outcome of your internal review, you
can contact the Information Commissioners Office. The Information
Commissioner can be contacted at: The Information Commissioner's Office,
Wycliffe House, Water Lane, Wilmslow, Cheshire SK9 5AF, telephone 0303 123
1113, or for further details see their website [3]www.ico.org.uk
